TimeSeries¶

class u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries(series: pandas.core.series.Series, confidence_lo: pandas.core.series.Series = None, confidence_hi: pandas.core.series.Series = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A TimeSeries is an immutable object defined by the following three components:

Parameters

  • series – The actual time series, as a pandas Series with a proper time index.

  • confidence_lo – Optionally, a Pandas Series representing lower confidence interval.

  • confidence_hi – Optionally, a Pandas Series representing upper confidence interval.

Within this class, TimeSeries type annotations are ‘TimeSeries’; see: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15853469/putting-current-class-as-return-type-annotation

Computes the auto-correlation of the TimeSeries at lag m.

Appends another TimeSeries to this TimeSeries.

Parameters

Returns

A new TimeSeries, obtained by appending the second TimeSeries to the first.

Returns the underlying Pandas Series of the upper confidence interval if it exists.

describe(percentiles=None, include=None, exclude=None) → pandas.core.series.Series[source]¶
drop_after(ts: pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp) → u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries[source]¶

Drops everything after the provided timestamp ts, included.

The timestamp may not be in the TimeSeries. If it is, the timestamp will be dropped.

Parameters

ts – The timestamp that indicates cut-off time.

Returns

A new TimeSeries, with indices smaller than ts.

drop_before(ts: pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp) → u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries[source]¶

Drops everything before the provided timestamp ts, included.

The timestamp may not be in the TimeSeries. If it is, the timestamp will be dropped.

Parameters

ts – The timestamp that indicates cut-off time.

Returns

A new TimeSeries, with indices greater than ts.

Returns the duration of the TimeSeries.

Returns

A Timedelta of the duration of the TimeSeries.

end_time() → pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp[source]¶

Returns the end time of the time index.

Returns

A timestamp containing the last time of the TimeSeries.

freq() → pandas.tseries.offsets.DateOffset[source]¶

Returns the frequency of the TimeSeries.

Returns

A DateOffset with the frequency.

Returns the frequency of the TimeSeries.

A string with the frequency.

static from_dataframe(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, time_col: str, value_col: str, conf_lo_col: str = None, conf_hi_col: str = None) → u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries[source]¶

Returns a TimeSeries built from some DataFrame columns (ignoring DataFrame index)

Parameters

  • df – The DataFrame

  • time_col – The time column name (mandatory).

  • value_col – The value column name (mandatory).

  • conf_lo_col – The lower confidence interval column name (optional).

  • conf_hi_col – The upper confidence interval column name (optional).

Returns

A TimeSeries constructed from the inputs.

static from_times_and_values(times: pandas.core.indexes.datetimes.DatetimeIndex, values: numpy.ndarray, confidence_lo: numpy.ndarray = None, confidence_hi: numpy.ndarray = None) → u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries[source]¶

Returns a TimeSeries built from an index and values.

Parameters

  • times – A DateTimeIndex for the TimeSeries.

  • values – An array of values for the TimeSeries.

  • confidence_lo – The lower confidence interval values (optional).

  • confidence_hi – The higher confidence interval values (optional).

Returns

A TimeSeries constructed from the inputs.

has_same_time_as(other: u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries) → bool[source]¶

Checks whether this TimeSeries and another one have the same index.

Parameters

other – A second TimeSeries.

Returns

A boolean. True if both TimeSeries have the same index, False otherwise.

intersect(other: u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries) → u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries[source]¶

Returns a slice containing the intersection of this TimeSeries and the one provided in argument.

Parameters

other – A second TimeSeries.

Returns

A new TimeSeries, with values of this TimeSeries and indices the intersection of both TimeSeries’ indices.

Returns the underlying Pandas Series of this TimeSeries.

Returns

A Pandas Series, copy of the underlying series to this TimeSeries.

plot(*args, plot_ci=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Currently this is just a wrapper around pd.Series.plot()

rescale_with_value(value_at_first_step: float) → u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries[source]¶

Returns a new TimeSeries, which is a multiple of this TimeSeries such that the first value is value_at_first_step.

Parameters

value_at_first_step – The new value for the first entry of the TimeSeries.

Returns

A new TimeSeries, whose first value was changed to value_at_first_step and whose others values have been scaled accordingly.

shift(n: int) → u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries[source]¶

Shifts the time axis of this TimeSeries by n time steps.

If n > 0, shifts in the future. If n < 0, shifts in the past.

For example, with n =2 and freq=’M’, March 2013 becomes May 2013. With n = -2, March 2013 becomes Jan 2013.

Parameters

n – The signed number of time steps to shift by.

Returns

A new TimeSeries, with a shifted index.

skew(axis=None, skipna=None, level=None, numeric_only=None, **kwargs) → float[source]¶
slice(start_ts: pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp, end_ts: pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp) → u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries[source]¶

Returns a new TimeSeries, starting later than start_ts and ending before end_ts, inclusive on both ends.

The timestamps may not be in the time series. If any is, it will be included in the new time series.

Parameters

  • start_ts – The timestamp that indicates the left cut-off.

  • end_ts – The timestamp that indicates the right cut-off.

Returns

A new TimeSeries, which indices greater or equal than start_ts and smaller or equal than end_ts.

slice_n_points_after(start_ts: pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp, n: int) → u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries[source]¶

Returns a new TimeSeries, starting later than start_ts (included) and having (at most) n points.

The timestamp may not be in the time series. If it is, it will be included in the new TimeSeries.

Parameters

  • start_ts – The timestamp that indicates the splitting time.

  • n – The maximal length of the new TimeSeries.

Returns

A new TimeSeries, with length at most n and indices greater or equal than start_ts.

slice_n_points_before(end_ts: pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp, n: int) → u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries[source]¶

Returns a new TimeSeries, ending before end_ts (included) and having (at most) n points.

The timestamp may not be in the TimeSeries. If it is, it will be included in the new TimeSeries.

Parameters

  • end_ts – The timestamp that indicates the splitting time.

  • n – The maximal length of the new time series.

Returns

A new TimeSeries, with length at most n and indices smaller or equal than end_ts.

split_after(ts: pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp) → Tuple[u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries, u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries][source]¶

Splits the TimeSeries in two, around a provided timestamp ts.

The timestamp may not be in the TimeSeries. If it is, the timestamp will be included in the first of the two TimeSeries, and not in the second.

Parameters

ts – The timestamp that indicates the splitting time.

Returns

A tuple (s1, s2) of TimeSeries with indices smaller or equal to ts and greater than ts respectively.

split_before(ts: pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp) → Tuple[u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries, u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries][source]¶

Splits a TimeSeries in two, around a provided timestamp ts.

The timestamp may not be in the TimeSeries. If it is, the timestamp will be included in the second of the two TimeSeries, and not in the first.

Parameters

ts – The timestamp that indicates the splitting time.

Returns

A tuple (s1, s2) of TimeSeries with indices smaller than ts and greater or equal to ts respectively.

start_time() → pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp[source]¶

Returns the start time of the time index.

Returns

A timestamp containing the first time of the TimeSeries.

std(axis=None, skipna=None, level=None, ddof=1, numeric_only=None, **kwargs) → float[source]¶
sum(axis=None, skipna=None, level=None, numeric_only=None, min_count=0, **kwargs) → float[source]¶
time_index() → pandas.core.indexes.datetimes.DatetimeIndex[source]¶

Returns the index of the TimeSeries.

Returns

A DatetimeIndex containing the index of the TimeSeries.

values() → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Returns the values of the TimeSeries.

Returns

A numpy array containing the values of the TimeSeries.

var(axis=None, skipna=None, level=None, ddof=1, numeric_only=None, **kwargs) → float[source]¶
